title: Long Scroll Box (Nagafubako) with Wild-Carnation Crest Design
creditline: Harvard Art Museums/Arthur M. Sackler Museum, The Elaine Ehrenkranz Collection of Japanese Lacquer Boxes; Gift of Elaine Ehrenkranz
dated: Style of the Muromachi period, late 15th or early 16th century
medium: Lacquer on wood with decoration in gold utilizing the hiramaki-e (low-relief sprinkled design), nashiji ("pear-skinned" ground), and kanagai (sheet gold and silver appliqu√©) techniques; metal fittings
